title: (x) Wonderful Pixel/Bitmappy - Lilany {Kemie}
content:
I found this at Knitty.com and the editor REFUSES to tell anyone her secret font. I found a freeware typeface that is very similar called Teacher's Pet, but it doesn't connect nicely the way this does. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/4861.gif)

 [‹ (x) William Blair & Company - unknown](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/typophile.com/node/9075 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Union Pacific Railroad - various {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/typophile.com/node/8838 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fluffypancakes

comments.content:
I swear I've seen that before...   
   
I guess not, I was thinking of Kemie Guaida's. It's close, but not quite:   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/632.html?1016807017](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/632.html?1016807017)   
   
There's also Miguel Hern

[Bangalore](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/www.9031.com/p-font/) is still the world's best small pixel script.   
But that's not it either.

Didn't find that font, but in searching for it I stumbled upon a [really nice collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/bitmapmania.m78.com/) of diverse pixel fonts. Now I can actually see myself trying pixel fonts in a web design, whereas before I thought it was just a trend I was hoping would go away.

Try superscript from [www.vectorize.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/www.vectorize.de/)  
It's not the one but its good.

You know what I just realized? Making an automatic bitmap font ID system should be possible, and not too hard. I mean once you've compiled a database of bitmap fonts, or at least their distinctive glyphs.   
   
hhp

another similar one (and imo nicer) here:   
 [http://www.lolailonline.com/eng/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/www.lolailonline.com/eng/)
Even if I never find out what the one I am looking for is, everyone here has offered really great suggestions and in some cases, some that are even better. Thanks!

I found it!!!!   
its called lilany, and you can get it at:   
 [http://www.pixelyn.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304/http:/www.pixelyn.net/)   
   
(Strange... very similar face and name to my lilabit ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) )

Nice work, kemie. Yes, I can't help but suspect that Pixelyn   
was "inspired" by your work (assuming Lilany was designed   
after Lilabit.)
Hi Kemie. Great stuff. But I couldn't find lilabit on your pixilate site. Can you post a link? Thanks.

lilabit is not yet finished, sadly. I   
 wouldnt assume any inspiration, stephen, as strong similarities are inevitable in bitmap/pixel fonts...

Wow, thanks for the link Kemie! Thanks to everyone that suggested other similar typefaces, you are a most helpful bunch! ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811072304im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
